messages.subject: RE: [SHQ_Spy_Division] Re: The Courtship of Lady Tokio
messages.msgSnippet: Youkoso irasshaimashita! Glad to have you here. I m the one from this group who found your story...and I was simply blown away by it. I m in college and
messages.messageBody:
Youkoso irasshaimashita! Glad to have you here. I'm the one from this group
who found your story...and I was simply blown away by it. I'm in college and
working on a Bakumatsu and Aizu-centered honors thesis, so I keep my eyes
out for things like this. Your work is truly spectacular.

Yoroshiku onegai moushiagemasu!

-Masayoshi

messages.subject: Re: The Courtship of Lady Tokio
messages.msgSnippet: ... Hello everybody, Please excuse me if I m imposing necessarily on your inbox capacities, but having never belonged to a mailing group before, I m not very
messages.messageBody:
--- In SHQ_Spy_Division@yahoogroups.com, "secretary"
<secretarytocapt3@h...> wrote:
>
> http://www.fanfiction.net/s/2049030/1/
> check out her cool fanart at http://www.hakubaikou.com under
> contributors profile name "MIO"

Hello everybody,

Please excuse me if I'm imposing necessarily on your inbox
capacities, but having never belonged to a mailing group before, I'm
not very sure about the etiquette. Also, please excuse me for not
having introduced myself earlier, but work has been very busy.
Tiffany aka secretarytocapt3 has been kind enough to invite me to
join, and frankly, I am amazed by this group, as well as the SHQ. I
do most of my research in Japanese, so I am sorry to say that I did
not know about this site until she directed me (my loss), so my
gratitude to Tiffany.
And to my embarrassment, she has already promoted my work for me,
and I didn't realise it until today. Oh dear. Well, she says that I
have some readers here, so hello to everyone, and also, why have you
not told me about this place before?!
So, as she already posted the link, I guess, some of you might know
a bit about me. But just to summarise what you'll find in the
Author's notes and such, I'm Japanese, I am quite obsessed with
Saitou, I work for NHK in DC, and I just wanted to say thank you
very much for this wonderful place and letting me join.
I can't say that I'll be a very active member as the drudgery of
work continues through the weekend for the media, but I really do
enjoy people enjoying the Shinsengumi, so I look forward to reading
all the messages.

Best wishes to all for a lovely weekend,

Mio (or misaki-toyodome)
